markdown.markdown:
[What is Logseq]{.titlerose .large} [What is Logseq]{.titlerose .large}
- Open-source tool for **PKM** and **task organization** - Networked outliner - Folder agnostic
![](Logseq_files/images/logseq_structure.png){.fragment width="1400px" height="500px"} [Key Features of Logseq:]{.titlerose .large}
[Outliner-Based Workflow]{.midi} ::: {.slide-content fragment-index="2"} - Structures notes into **blocks** (or *paragraphs*)
- *everything in Logseq is about the **blocks**!*
- Blocks can be nested hierarchically for: - Outlining ideas - Organizing complex thoughts - Easy to reorganize or move blocks ::: [Key Features of Logseq:]{.titlerose .large}
[Backlinks and Linking]{.midi}
- Create links using the `[[Link Syntax]]` - Backlinks: a link for a page that is shown to the current page - Encourages a **web of interconnected notes** [Key Features of Logseq:]{.titlerose .large}
[Journaling and Daily Notes]{.midi}
- Automatically creates a **daily note** - Acts as: - A chronological log. - A launchpad for other notes. ![](Logseq_files/images/backlinks.png){width="1900px" height="900px"} [Key Features of Logseq:]{.titlerose .large}
[Task Management]{.midi}
- Integrates tasks directly into your notes: - LATER -> NOW -> DONE - TODO -> DOING -> DONE - CANCELED/CANCELLED, IN-PROGRESS, and WAIT/WAITING - Tasks can be tracked across notes using **queries**. [Key Features of Logseq:]{.titlerose .large}
[Task Management - Priorities]{.midi}
- [Key Features of Logseq:]{.titlerose .large}
[Page Properties]{.midi}
- Uses **key-value pairs** for structured data: - `priority:: A deadline:: 2024-12-01` - Helps organize and filter notes based on specific criteria. - Dynamically search for and display notes or tasks. - Uses **Clojure syntax** for powerful, customizable queries. - Example: {{query (and \[\[decision-making\]\] (priority A))}} ## Key Features of Logseq: Local-First and Privacy-Focused - **Notes stored locally** on your device. - Ensures privacy: - No reliance on cloud storage. - Fully functional offline. - Ideal for users valuing security and data control. # What Makes Logseq Different? - **Block-Based Organization**: - Granular control over information. - **Folderless Structure**: - Organizes dynamically using links, tags, and properties. - **Emphasis on Journaling**: - Daily notes are central to its workflow. - **Open-Source and Extensible**: - Community-driven, customizable ecosystem. - **Interconnected Knowledge**: - Builds a network of ideas, not isolated files. - **Advanced Queries**: - Extract meaningful insights with customizable searches. # Who Should Use Logseq? - Ideal for: - Researchers, students, and professionals. - Especially useful for those who: - Need **dynamic organization** of ideas. - Want a **combined journaling and task-tracking system**. - Prefer **interconnected knowledge networks**. - Require **privacy-focused, offline-friendly tools**. #
